thread.title: Is Mets manager Terry Collins using Jeurys Familia too much because he doesn't trust his bullpen?
thread.title_full: Is Mets manager Terry Collins using Jeurys Familia too much because he doesn't trust his bullpen?

author: Mike Vorkunov | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Is Mets manager Terry Collins using Jeurys Familia too much because he doesn't trust his bullpen?
text:
Comments 
NEW YORK â€” After Jeurys Familia finished another Mets postseason win (he's 4-for-4 now) in the Mets 4-2 Game 1 victory over the Cubs and pitched in another game (he's appeared in five of six), manager Terry Collins was asked point blank: Are you circumventing the rest of your bullpen to get from the starters to the star closer? 
"I'm not trying to," Collins said. "I'm not trying to. It's just we've got pretty good starting pitching, and if they can get deep into the game -- you've got, again, what I think is one of the best closers in baseball. If you can get your starters to give you eight, and turn the ball over to him, I like your chances. But believe me, I like the guys that are setting up." 
Collins can hardly be faulted for using Familia so much. He's been really good. In six appearances, he hasn't allowed a run. He's only allowed just one hit and struck out four batters. RELATED: WATCH: Chicago Cubs learn why you don't run on Mets' Yoenis Cespedes 
Familia pitched the final inning of Game 3 despite a six-run lead. He pitched the final two innings of the Game 5 win over the Dodgers. Then he got the last four outs Saturday night. 
Even if it's not intended, it seems that Collins doesn't have full confidence in the rest of his bullpen. Tyler Clippard and Addison Reed have struggled. Bartolo Colon has become a middle reliever. And Familia has become a workhorse after 43 saves this season. 
"I don't know, maybe Jeurys tomorrow night will need a night off and we can close with (Tyler Clippard) and set up with Addison (Reed)," Collins said. "We've got options down there. But when you've got Jake who is going deep into games, and tonight Matt went deep in the game, I'm hoping Noah tomorrow goes deep in the game. That's the perfect scenario. Sometimes it happens and sometimes it doesn't, but when it does, I think you've got to go to it."
